detailed_description: CARTA is a next-generation image visualization and analysis tool designed for ALMA, VLA, and SKA pathfinders. It provides a client-server architecture for viewing large astronomical images and cubes efficiently.

name: CARTA Backend
one_line_profile: Backend server for the CARTA visualization tool
detailed_description: The backend component of CARTA, responsible for handling data access, image processing, and streaming visualization data to the frontend.

name: CARTA Frontend
one_line_profile: Frontend interface for the CARTA visualization tool
detailed_description: The web-based frontend component of CARTA, providing the user interface for interacting with astronomical images and cubes.

name: voe

detailed_description: A Python library for handling Virtual Observatory Events (VOEvents) specifically tailored for Fast Radio Burst (FRB) detection and alerts, developed by the CHIME/FRB collaboration.

name: Firefly (IPAC)

detailed_description: Firefly is a web framework for building astronomical data access and visualization applications. It is used by IPAC for archives like IRSA and LSST.

name: ASTAP
one_line_profile: Astrometric Stacking Program and Plate Solver
detailed_description: ASTAP is a free astrometric solver, stacking program, and FITS viewer. It is widely used for plate solving in astrophotography to determine the precise celestial coordinates of an image.

name: toasty
one_line_profile: Pipeline for creating WWT TOAST data tiles
detailed_description: A Python library to generate TOAST (Tessellated Octahedral Adaptive Subdivision Transform) tiles from astronomical images for visualization in the WorldWide Telescope (WWT) ecosystem.

name: HORAYZON
one_line_profile: Terrain parameter and shadow map computation tool
detailed_description: A package to efficiently compute terrain parameters (horizon, sky view factor, slope) and shadow maps from high-resolution digital elevation models (DEM), useful for meteorology and earth science.

name: whampy
one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization tool for WHAM Sky Survey
detailed_description: A Python package designed to interact with, visualize, and analyze data from the Wisconsin H-Alpha Mapper (WHAM) Sky Survey.

name: stac-finder
one_line_profile: API for browsing SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs (STAC)
detailed_description: A STAC-compliant API implementation for browsing and searching SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs, facilitating the discovery of geospatial and earth observation data.

name: fitsgeo
one_line_profile: PHITS geometry development and visualization tool
detailed_description: A Python package for developing and visualizing geometries for the PHITS (Particle and Heavy Ion Transport code System) Monte Carlo transport code.

name: dustmaps3d
one_line_profile: 3D dust map based on Gaia and LAMOST data
detailed_description: A tool/library to access and visualize an all-sky 3D dust map derived from Gaia and LAMOST survey data, useful for studying interstellar medium extinction.

name: swarmlib
one_line_profile: Library implementing swarm optimization algorithms for scientific computing
detailed_description: A Python library that implements and visualizes various swarm intelligence optimization algorithms (PSO, ACO, GWO, etc.), which are commonly used in scientific modeling and parameter estimation tasks.

name: gw_sky
one_line_profile: Gravitational wave sky map visualization tool
detailed_description: A Python project designed for generating sky maps and animations specifically for gravitational wave astronomy, aiding in the visualization of source localization.

name: gleamvo-client
one_line_profile: Client API for GLEAM Virtual Observatory access
detailed_description: A Python client library for accessing the GLEAM (GaLactic and Extragalactic All-sky MWA) Virtual Observatory, facilitating astronomical data retrieval and query.

name: CartAGen (Java)
one_line_profile: Cartographic generalisation plugin for GeOxygene
detailed_description: A Java-based plugin for the GeOxygene platform dedicated to cartographic generalisation, a process in GIS and geography for deriving smaller scale maps from larger scale data.

name: ImagePy
one_line_profile: Extensible image processing framework for scientific imaging
detailed_description: An open-source image processing framework written in Python, designed to be extensible like ImageJ. It integrates with Scipy, Scikit-image, and OpenCV to provide a platform for scientific image analysis.

name: AstroImages.jl
one_line_profile: Astronomical image visualization library for Julia
detailed_description: A Julia library dedicated to the visualization of astronomical images, providing tools to handle and display FITS data and other astronomical formats within the Julia ecosystem.

name: SAOImageDS9.jl
one_line_profile: Julia interface to SAOImage DS9
detailed_description: A Julia package that provides an interface to the SAOImage DS9 astronomical imaging and data visualization application via the XPA messaging system.

name: FIt-SNE
one_line_profile: Fast Fourier Transform-accelerated Interpolation-based t-SNE
detailed_description: A highly optimized implementation of t-SNE using FFT acceleration, widely used in bioinformatics (e.g., single-cell RNA-seq) and data science for visualizing high-dimensional datasets.

name: auto_stretch
one_line_profile: Automated contrast stretching for FITS image visualization
detailed_description: A Python tool developed by LCOGT to automatically determine optimal contrast stretch parameters for astronomical FITS images, facilitating quick visualization.

name: skyproj
one_line_profile: Astronomical sky mapping with Matplotlib and PROJ
detailed_description: A Python library from LSST DESC for creating publication-quality sky maps using Matplotlib and PROJ, supporting various cartographic projections relevant to astronomy.

name: X-LoVoCCS-Data
one_line_profile: Data processing workflow for LoVoCCS X-ray survey
detailed_description: A repository containing the code and pipelines used to create the multi-mission X-ray data archive for the Local Volume Complete Cluster Survey (LoVoCCS).

name: cartagen (Python)

detailed_description: An open-source Python library for cartographic generalisation, providing algorithms to simplify map data while preserving essential topological and geographic characteristics.

name: OpenSpace

detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source software platform for visualizing the entire known universe, portraying ongoing efforts to investigate the cosmos. It supports interactive data visualization for astronomy and space science.

name: SAOImageDS9
one_line_profile: Astronomical imaging and data visualization application
detailed_description: SAOImage DS9 is a visualization application for astronomical imaging and data analysis. It supports FITS images and binary tables, multiple frame buffers, region manipulation, and arbitrary scale algorithms and colormaps.

name: BAStag
one_line_profile: Data processing for British Antarctic Survey archival tags
detailed_description: A package for processing light-level geolocation data from British Antarctic Survey archival tags. It provides functions to detect twilight events and estimate locations for tracking marine animals.

name: FITS-Rating-Tool
one_line_profile: Tool for viewing and automatically grading FITS files
detailed_description: A tool designed to view and automatically grade (quality control) astronomical images in FITS format. It helps astronomers sort and filter images based on quality metrics.

name: pywwt

detailed_description: The Python interface to WorldWide Telescope (WWT), allowing users to control the WWT visualization engine, load data, and create visualizations directly from Python environments like Jupyter notebooks.

name: wwt-excel-plugin

detailed_description: An add-in for Microsoft Excel that enables the visualization of astronomical data stored in spreadsheets directly within the WorldWide Telescope environment.

name: Firefly (ageller)
one_line_profile: WebGL interactive particle viewer for astronomy
detailed_description: A WebGL-based interactive viewer designed for visualizing particle data from astronomical simulations (e.g., star clusters, galaxies). It allows users to explore 3D datasets in a browser.

name: fink-client

detailed_description: A light-weight Python client to manipulate and retrieve astronomical alerts from the Fink broker, which processes data from surveys like ZTF and LSST.

name: STIFF
one_line_profile: FITS to TIFF converter for visualization
detailed_description: STIFF is a program that converts scientific FITS images to the TIFF format for visualization and illustration purposes, handling high dynamic range data effectively.

name: lenspyx
one_line_profile: Curved-sky CMB lensing simulation and processing package
detailed_description: A Python package for curved-sky Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) lensing simulation and analysis, providing tools for generating lensed maps and processing spherical harmonic transforms.

name: Aladin Desktop
one_line_profile: Interactive software sky atlas for astronomical data visualization and exploration
detailed_description: The desktop application of the CDS Aladin Sky Atlas project, allowing users to visualize digitized astronomical images, superimpose entries from astronomical catalogs, and interactively access related data and information from the Simbad database, the VizieR service, and other archives.

name: Aladin Lite
one_line_profile: Lightweight astronomical HiPS visualizer for web browsers
detailed_description: A lightweight version of the Aladin Sky Atlas running in the browser, enabling visualization of HiPS (Hierarchical Progressive Surveys) based sky maps and overlay of catalogs.

name: ipyaladin
one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for the Aladin Lite sky viewer
detailed_description: A Python library enabling the use of Aladin Lite within Jupyter notebooks, allowing interactive visualization of astronomical images and catalogs directly in a research workflow.

name: Virtual Language Observatory

detailed_description: A browser-based virtual observatory developed by CLARIN ERIC for searching and exploring linguistic resources, tools, and data across various repositories.

name: SemBERT

detailed_description: An implementation of SemBERT, a model that incorporates explicit contextual semantics (Semantic Role Labeling) into BERT for improved natural language understanding tasks.

name: HERMES

detailed_description: A computational framework designed to generate sky maps in HEALPix format by performing line-of-sight integration over galactic radiative processes, useful for astrophysical simulations.

name: CASDA VO Tools

detailed_description: A set of tools implementing Virtual Observatory (VO) protocols such as TAP, Cone Search, DataLink, and SIAP, specifically for the CSIRO ASKAP Science Data Archive.

one_line_profile: Tools for optical interferometry data processing and modeling

name: tessmaps

detailed_description: A Python tool designed to create sky maps of objects observed by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS). It aids astronomers in visualizing the spatial distribution of TESS targets.

one_line_profile: Fast Spherical Harmonic Transforms library
detailed_description: A Fortran library for performing fast Spherical Harmonic Transforms (SHT) on a large number of sky maps. This is a core computational tool in astrophysics for analyzing data on spherical domains, such as CMB analysis.

name: ALADIN (Drug-Target)

name: all_sky_phot
one_line_profile: All-sky camera transparency map generator

name: ALADIN (Image-Text)

name: QuickLook.Plugin.FitsViewer

name: baobab
one_line_profile: Training data generator for strong lensing hierarchical inference
detailed_description: A tool to generate training data for Bayesian neural networks aimed at performing hierarchical inference on strongly-lensed systems.

name: galaxies_datasets
one_line_profile: Collection of extragalactic astronomy datasets for machine learning
detailed_description: A Python package providing ready-to-use extragalactic astronomy datasets formatted for use with TensorFlow and other machine learning frameworks.

name: JAXtronomy
one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable gravitational lensing simulation tool
detailed_description: A JAX port of the lenstronomy package, enabling parallelized, GPU-accelerated, and differentiable gravitational lensing and image simulations.

name: lenstronomy
one_line_profile: Multi-purpose gravitational lens modeling software
detailed_description: A comprehensive software package for modeling gravitational lenses, capable of image simulation, source reconstruction, and cosmological inference.

name: legacy_sims_GalSimInterface
one_line_profile: Interface for generating LSST simulated images using GalSim
detailed_description: A software interface that connects LSST catalog simulations (CatSim) with GalSim to generate high-fidelity simulated astronomical images.

name: legacy_sims_operations
one_line_profile: LSST Operations Simulator (OpSim) package
detailed_description: A package for the LSST Operations Simulator (OpSim), used to simulate and plan the survey strategy and scheduling for the Rubin Observatory.

name: OPSim (Geant4)
one_line_profile: Additions to Geant4 toolkit for optical photon simulation applications
detailed_description: OpSim is a set of libraries and additions to the Geant4 simulation toolkit designed to simplify the implementation of optical photon applications and enhance flexibility in particle physics simulations.

name: galaxy-datasets
one_line_profile: Machine learning datasets and loaders for galaxy images
detailed_description: A library providing easy access to machine-learning-friendly datasets of galaxy images and labels, facilitating astronomical deep learning research.

name: analosis
one_line_profile: Analysis tools for investigating line-of-sight effects in strong lensing
detailed_description: A toolkit designed to work with lenstronomy for analyzing line-of-sight effects in strong gravitational lensing systems.

name: OpSim (Chemical Engineering)
one_line_profile: Open source Chemical Engineering Process Simulator
detailed_description: A chemical engineering process simulator featuring a graphical user interface and a high-performance simulation engine for modeling chemical processes.

name: cabaret
one_line_profile: Simulation of astronomical images using Gaia catalog
detailed_description: A Python package to simulate astronomical images based on star data from the Gaia catalog, useful for instrument calibration and observation planning.

name: OpenTestability
one_line_profile: Structural analysis tool for digital circuits and netlists
detailed_description: An open-source tool for structural analysis of digital circuits, computing metrics like SCOAP and COP from Verilog netlists for hardware engineering and testing.

name: Balrog (Bio)
one_line_profile: Bacterial Annotation by Learned Representation of Genes
detailed_description: A tool for bacterial gene annotation using learned representations, designed to predict gene functions in prokaryotic genomes.

name: BalrogCPP
one_line_profile: C++ implementation of Balrog for bacterial gene annotation
detailed_description: The C++ version of the Balrog tool for efficient bacterial gene annotation and representation learning.

name: hierArc
one_line_profile: Hierarchical inference of cosmological parameters from strong lensing
detailed_description: A Python package for performing hierarchical inference of cosmological parameters using data from strong gravitational lensing systems.

name: psfr
one_line_profile: Point Spread Function reconstruction tool
detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing the Point Spread Function (PSF) from astronomical images, essential for accurate image analysis and source characterization.

name: Mirage (JWST)
one_line_profile: Simulator for JWST NIRCam, NIRISS, and FGS data
detailed_description: A Python tool developed by STScI to generate simulated data for the NIRCam, NIRISS, and FGS instruments on the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).

name: Balrog-GalSim
one_line_profile: GalSim modules for the DES Balrog pipeline
detailed_description: A set of modules for GalSim designed to support the Balrog pipeline for the Dark Energy Survey (DES), enabling the injection of synthetic objects into real astronomical images.

name: silkscreen
one_line_profile: Distance measurement to galaxies using ArtPop and SBI
detailed_description: A tool that combines ArtPop (stellar population synthesis) and Simulation-Based Inference (SBI) to measure distances to galaxies directly from their images.

name: online_photometric_calibration
one_line_profile: Implementation of online photometric calibration for vision systems
detailed_description: An implementation of online photometric calibration algorithms, useful for computer vision and robotic visual SLAM systems to handle lighting variations.
